page.title: 05Newcastle; Byker redevt.
page.content: In the 1950's people decided that {Byker}needed redevelopment. The houses were old, they had outdoor toilets and coal fires. In 1969{Ralph {Erskine}was appointed architect and planner for the area. He decided to plan a complete environment keeping the traditions of the area. People would be rehoused then brought back to their new houses. The architects wanted to involve people in the redevelopment. The houses have bright colours and different patterns and type of brick. The roofs are different shapes. Wood was used for balconies and decoration. There is lots of green space to play in. Old buildings like churches and pubs were kept. Houses are heated by hot water pumped from the refuse incineration plant on Walker Road. Byker is a nice place to live in.
